title: Pedagogical Agent-Based Conversational Microlearning for Improved Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Secondary Social Studies Curriculum and Experience with Digital Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Program for in-service secondary social studies teachers to strengthen curriculum design and implementation competencies. Building conversation-based learning environments using digital devices

learning_goals: Learners explain at least 85% of core social studies concepts through pedagogical agent interactions and linguistic exchanges
Learners complete 100% of instructional design tasks using agent feedback and achieve an average score of 4.0+ (5-point scale) in peer evaluations

Based on a 4-week learning experience in an Agent-Based Learning Environment (ABLE), learners write three reflective journals, create a comparative analysis table with three peers, and derive improvements of 80% or higher in at least two of the three learning effectiveness indicators (engagement, comprehension, satisfaction).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
